title: Narratives of Climate Adaptation in Coastal Communities
one_line_takeaway: Coastal adaptation narratives emphasize community-led responses to climate risk.
research_question: How do coastal communities narrate adaptation to climate change?
key_claims: Community narratives frame adaptation as collective stewardship.
Local storytelling shapes perceived climate risk and response.
Qualitative interviews reveal recurring resilience motifs.
evidence_or_method: Qualitative interviews and thematic analysis of adaptation narratives.
limitations: Small sample size and region-specific focus.
relevance_to_topic: Provides direct insight into how adaptation narratives are constructed.

title: Storytelling and Resilience Planning
one_line_takeaway: Storytelling influences resilience planning by aligning stakeholders around shared goals.
research_question: What role does storytelling play in resilience policy design?
key_claims: Storytelling improves engagement in planning workshops.
Resilience policies often reflect dominant narrative frames.
evidence_or_method: Comparative case analysis of resilience planning documents.
relevance_to_topic: Connects narrative framing to practical adaptation planning outcomes.
